moves.1. b4: My favourite opening. The orangutan. Uncommon and very unusual. Few players use this opening.
moves.3... Be6: Nott one of the players that I have played this opening against have come back with this sequence of moves.
moves.5. d3 Be7: He is now free to castle whenever he wants.
moves.6. g3: I rarely play the king fiancetto but the centre is very crowded and I don't want to further that. Besides I like closed up king-sides and open queen-sides.
moves.6... O-O 7. Bg2: The second step in the fiancetto. His king is already safe so I want to geet a move on.
moves.7... Nc6 8. Nf3: I'm fine with leaving the b4 pawn unguarded because I can sense a push down the centre. And I'm worried about the d4 square.
moves.9. exd5 Nxd5 10. Nxd5 Bxd5: I can sense that he is keen to attack now. I have to be careful.
moves.11. O-O: The king fiancetto is now complete.
moves.12... Be6 13. b5 Nb4: Mistake! d4 would've been better. He might lose his knight now.
moves.15. a3: At this point black resigned. His knight is trapped and it is one of his few developed pieces. It seems that he thought it was a pivotal piece and he couldn't afford to lose it.
